key_points: President Joe Biden emphasized the importance of investigating the origins of COVID-19.
Biden recalled his early call for CDC access to China to understand the virus better.
He mentioned the hinderance faced due to the inability to get inspectors in China during the early stages of the pandemic.
In March, shortly after becoming President, Biden tasked the Intelligence Community with preparing a report on the virus's origins.
The Intelligence Community's report outlined two likely scenarios but did not reach a definitive conclusion.
Biden has requested the Intelligence Community to intensify their efforts to analyze information related to the virus's origins.
He has given them 90 days to report back with a more definitive conclusion.
The investigation includes asking for specific questions to be directed towards China.
Biden emphasized collaboration with international partners to press China for a transparent investigation.
The effort will involve multiple agencies, including National Labs, to support the Intelligence Community's work.
